description: Description: In this unit, students will be introduced to fundamental data structures such as arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs. They will learn about the characteristics and usage of each data structure and how they are implemented in code using a programming language like Python or Java.
introduction: In Unit 1, students will embark on a journey to explore the world of fundamental data structures. By the end of this unit, students will have a deep understanding of arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs, and how they are used in computer science. This knowledge is crucial for any aspiring computer scientist as it forms the foundation for solving complex problems efficiently. Students will not only learn how to implement these data structures in Python or Java but also gain the skills to analyze their performance through time and space complexity analysis. This unit will not only equip students with technical skills but also critical thinking and problem-solving abilities that are essential for their future career in computer science.
objectives: 1. Define and explain the characteristics of common data structures.
2. Implement data structures in code using Python or Java.
3. Analyze the time and space complexity of data structures.
title: Unit 1: Introduction to Data Structures

description: Description: This unit will focus on various algorithms for searching, sorting, and graph traversal. Students will learn how to analyze the time and space complexity of algorithms and evaluate their efficiency in solving problems.
introduction: In Unit 2, students will delve into the world of algorithms for searching, sorting, and graph traversal. They will learn how to implement these algorithms and analyze their time and space complexity. By the end of the unit, students will be able to evaluate the efficiency of algorithms in solving programming challenges. This knowledge is essential for students aspiring to pursue a career in computer science, as it equips them with the skills needed to develop optimized solutions to complex problems. Understanding these fundamental algorithms will not only enhance students' problem-solving abilities but also prepare them for the challenges they may face in their future careers in computer science.
objectives: 1. Implement algorithms for searching, sorting, and graph traversal.
2. Analyze the time and space complexity of algorithms.
3. Evaluate the efficiency of algorithms in solving programming challenges.
title: Unit 2: Algorithms and Efficiency Analysis

description: Description: In this final unit, students will apply their knowledge of data structures and algorithms to solve programming challenges and real-world problems. They will work on practical projects that require the use of data structures and algorithms.
introduction: In Unit 3, students will dive deep into the practical application of data structures and algorithms. They will learn how to apply their knowledge to solve programming challenges and real-world problems, gaining hands-on experience through project-based learning. By the end of the unit, students will be able to implement solutions using data structures and algorithms, demonstrating proficiency in practical applications. This unit will not only enhance their technical skills but also prepare them for success in their future careers in computer science. By mastering data structures and algorithms, students will be equipped to tackle any programming challenge with confidence and creativity.
objectives: 1. Apply data structures and algorithms to solve programming challenges.
2. Implement solutions to real-world problems using data structures and algorithms.
3. Demonstrate proficiency in using data structures and algorithms in practical applications.
title: Unit 3: Application of Data Structures and Algorithms
